strings.Value: "What were you saying about the city? What do you mean 'it's stuffy'?"
"Have any of the men come with you? We'll need help in the dungeon."

"Good afternoon, Baron! Sir Cephal summoned me with a sending spell yesterday. – I suppose right at the moment you were setting camp. He asked that reinforcements and supplies be brought from Varnhold. I came as fast as I could."
"Hello again. Are you on business or just want to chat?"

"If I could explain better, I would. It's bad there, like something is going to happen. I talk to the people – many are having nightmares, always the same. Always about tearing their own eyes out. Fun, isn't it?"
"He's hanging about at the tavern, writing and writing for days on end. He's been stranger than usual lately. Pale as a ghost, dark circles under his eyes, like he hasn't slept for a few nights."
"Go. And speed the Baron's steps. Let him be finished with this backwater quickly and get home."
"Cephal, keen foresight as ever. Good job! Kjerdi, report on the situation in Varnhold."

"Everything seems calm, Baron. The Host are standing guard. No one is making any trouble. No sign of cyclopes. Only it's... stuffy, you know. I wish I could explain it better. Like a storm is building over the city. You should return. They need you there."

"We are here with the express aim of protecting the city. It's all right, Kjerdi. Wait for us here. {name} and Cephal will go check the supplies you've brought. We might need something for the expedition into the tomb."
